plot outline: Raghuraman, the owner of a tea plantation in Ooty, takes a walk to the park where he meets Sudukhar the father of a young girl who is playing with her on the playground. The two men begin to talk, and soon Raghuraman is recounting the entire history of his loving relationship with his daughter Abhi, including her first day at school, her growth to independence, and her eventual marriage to Joginder Singh, a gem of a man who turns out to have many surprising qualities. At each stage, this doting father has had difficulty separating from his loving daughter, and accepting her marriage was the hardest. The story as a whole is a gentle and loving comedy with some depth in the narrative.

Raghuram and his wife Anu have one daughter, Abhi. They are a lovable family, financially comfortable, facing no health or other major problems. But Raghuram loves his daughter so much that he is obsessed with trying to guide her every little step. Thus as Abhi grows, Raghuram must himself "grow" and gradually learn -- with comic results -- how to trust his daughter to live her own life.::sshogben
